title: The Data Tables
subtitle: Introduction to CSV Files
description:
# CSV Files: Spreadsheet Data in Python

üìä **CSV** (Comma-Separated Values) is the universal spreadsheet format!

## What is CSV?

```csv
name,level,health,class
Warrior,10,150,warrior
Mage,12,70,mage
Rogue,11,100,rogue
```

## Python's csv Module

```python
import csv

# Read CSV
with open('data.csv', 'r') as f:
    reader = csv.DictReader(f)
    for row in reader:
        print(row['name'], row['level'])
```

‚öîÔ∏è Master CSV reading!
starterCode:
import csv
import io

# Sample CSV data
CSV_DATA = '''name,level,health,class
Warrior,10,150,warrior
Mage,12,70,mage
Rogue,11,100,rogue'''

print("=== CSV Reader ===")
print()

# TODO: Parse CSV with csv.DictReader
reader = csv.DictReader(io.StringIO(CSV_DATA))

# TODO: Loop and print each character
for row in reader:
    print(f"{row['name']} (Lv {row['level']}) - {row['health']} HP")

print("\nCSV read complete!")
solutionCode:
import csv
import io

CSV_DATA = '''name,level,health,class
Warrior,10,150,warrior
Mage,12,70,mage
Rogue,11,100,rogue'''

print("=== CSV Reader ===")
print()

reader = csv.DictReader(io.StringIO(CSV_DATA))

for row in reader:
    print(f"{row['name']} (Lv {row['level']}) - {row['health']} HP")

print("\nCSV read complete!")
